intro: Hieracium eriocerinthe, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, often reddish stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium eriocerinthe is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
